Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Retrocyclin-2 (RC2; HTD-2; synthetic AMPs20, 3S=S, Cys-rich; UCBB1ab; XXC, BBS, lectin, ZZHs; BBBH2o)
Sequence Information.Source: mammal theta-defensin; Derived from a silent human gene  (pre-stop), animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: RTD-like theta-defensin derived from human pseudogenes.Activity: RC2 is most active against primary isolates of HIV-1. The molecule can self associate in water in a concentration dependent manner.Structure:  In 2007, a low-resolution structure was initially determined in the presence of SDS micelles (PDB ID: 2ATG). In 2012, a high-resolution structure was determined in water (Conibear AC et al., 2012).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.MOA:virus: It binds to gp120 and CD4, thereby inhibiting HIV entry (Wang W J Immunol 2004; 173:515-520). Updated 11/29/2012; 2/2014; 7/2021 GW.
Literature Information.Author: Wang W, Owen SM, Rudolph DL, Cole AM, Hong T, Waring AJ, Lal RB, Lehrer RI.
Literature Information.Title: Activity of alpha- and theta-defensins against primary isolates of HIV-1.
